author: sky.cactus

author: sky.cactus
content: API design is hard, because you don't want to send too much data (waste of bandwidth due to bloated responses) and you don't want to send too little data (waste of bandwidth by having to make repeat calls).

author: sky.cactus
content: Ideal solution would be something like GraphQL, but that is separate from the JSON-RPC API, thus we are left with this question...

author: sky.cactus

content:
> It can provide an incentive for the poke that's equal to basefee + N gwei
<@!273808422753796097> This makes sense. An example: Cryptokitties has a cat birth fee that was typically 0.008 eth for whoever "poked" the contract when the kitten was ready. But as gas prices changed, they had to manually increase their birth fee (0.032 eth now). That caused issues when they failed to increase birth fee, effectively shutting down new births whenever ethereum network got clogged
